slides.title: SMS Marketing

content.headline: 98% Open Rate. That's Not a Typo.

slides.narration: Email open rates average twenty percent. SMS? Ninety-eight percent. And most texts are read within three minutes. But there are rules. Let's set up SMS marketing the right way.

slides.title: What You'll Learn
slides.narration: We'll cover compliance requirements—critical for SMS. Building your SMS list legally. Message types that actually work. And timing and frequency best practices so you don't annoy people.

slides.title: Step 1: Compliance Setup
slides.narration: SMS has strict compliance requirements. You must have written consent before texting—no exceptions. Every message needs an easy opt-out like 'Reply STOP.' Identify your business in messages. Follow TCPA and CTIA guidelines. Keep records of consent. Violations can cost thousands per message.

slides.title: Step 2: Build Your List
slides.narration: Build your list properly. Keyword signup: 'Text JOIN to our number.' Website signup form with clear consent language. Point of sale prompt when customers are engaged. Invite existing customers via email. Always offer value for signing up—exclusive deals, early access, useful updates.

slides.title: Step 3: Message Types
slides.narration: What works in SMS? Appointment reminders—practical value. Flash sales and limited-time offers—urgency. Order and delivery updates—expected information. Event reminders—timely and helpful. Exclusive subscriber deals—reward for opting in. Avoid daily messages, generic content, and long texts that get truncated.

slides.title: Step 4: Timing Strategy
slides.narration: Timing strategy. Two to four messages per month maximum—more feels spammy. Business hours only, roughly ten AM to eight PM. Avoid Monday mornings when people are overwhelmed. Send time-sensitive offers two to four hours before the deadline. Never text before nine AM, after nine PM, or on holidays unless directly relevant.

slides.title: Pro Tips
slides.narration: SMS pro tips. Keep messages under one hundred sixty characters to avoid splitting. Include a clear call to action—what should they do? Personalize with name when possible. Track offer redemption with unique codes so you know what works.

slides.title: Start SMS Marketing
slides.narration: Ready for ninety-eight percent open rates? Set up SMS marketing now—we'll guide you through compliance. Or see message templates first for inspiration. The most direct line to your customers, done right.
